Source.Name: zile
Source.Description: Zile is a small Emacs clone. Zile is a customizable, self-documenting real-time open-source display editor. Zile was written to be as similar as possible to Emacs; every Emacs user should feel at home.

Update.Comment: - version bump to 2.3.24 - fix kill-line with prefix argument
Update.Name: David Stegbauer

Update.Comment: - version bump to 2.3.23 - {beginning,end} of buffer now take account of transient-mark-mode
Update.Name: David Stegbauer

Update.Comment: - version bump to 2.3.22 - fix a bug in forward regex isearch introduced recently
Update.Name: David Stegbauer

Update.Comment: - fix a bug in backward search introduced in 2.3.18
Update.Name: David Stegbauer

Update.Comment: - fix a potential buffer overflow, - search and replace with embedded NULs, - fix bug introduced in 2.3.17 which caused consecutive kills not to save the killed text
Update.Name: David Stegbauer

Update.Comment: - fix a space leak, - fix a small bug in reading filenames in the minibuffer introduced in 2.3.18, - fix some behaviour that was not the same as Emacs
Update.Name: David Stegbauer

Update.Comment: - fix some minor space leaks - fix a read of freed memory - fix a bug in quoted-insert - stop Zile from catching the user signal SIGQUIT
Update.Name: David Stegbauer

Update.Comment: - fix some small bugs in delete-window - fix a potential buffer overrun - fix long-standing bug in the handling of the key string "C-_"
Update.Name: David Stegbauer

Update.Comment: - fix the default universal argument, which should be 4 but was 16 - improve Emacs compatibility - commands `suspend-zile', `save-buffers-kill-zile' and `view-zile-FAQ' are now called `suspend-emacs', `save-buffers-kill-emacs' and `view-emacs-FAQ' - `kill-line' now works with non-positive arguments - fix a crash in `find-alternate-file' - fix the +LINE command-line action - fix bugs in `kill-line`, `scroll-up' and `scroll-down' - fix a minor bug in filename tab expansion, which resulted in `/' being expanded to `~/'
Update.Name: David Stegbauer

Update.Comment: Moved from contrib to pardus repository.
Update.Name: David Stegbauer
